title: CD of Testimony Taken During US Navy Court of Inquiry into USS Liberty Attack

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CD of Testimony Taken During US Navy Court of Inquiry into USS Liberty Attack
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the IDF attacked our ship on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.

In June, 1967 the US Navy convened a Court of Inquiry to look into the June 8, 1967 attack on the USS Liberty.

Testimony taken by the court was recorded on a Dictaphone which was later converted to CD.

I am requesting a copy of the CD that contains the testimony before the US Navy Court of Inquiry into the attack on the USS Liberty.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI RECORDS for Vincent SICURELLA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please conduct a search for responsive records and hereby request the following:

Any and all records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation into  Vincent SICURELLA (AKA: Jim, AKA: Jimmy)

Vincent SICURELLA's Date  of death was  December 7, 2009. Here is a link to his obituary in the Buffalo News: https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/buffalonews/name/vincent-sicurella-obituary?id=4727802



SICURELLA is listed in the FBI's  2006 Buffalo LCN Chart.  I have attached a PDF of this chart. 

Please include any and all surveillance pictures and charts containing  and/or referring to Vincent "Jimmy" SICURELLA.  

In addition to conducting this search for records at the FBI Field Office in Buffalo, NY, please conduct an additional search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. 

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. 

If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mob

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NARA Equity Policy documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

By way of background: 

The general public has become aware of the disappearance of a number of official NARA policies or statements previously available through archives.gov—most or all of which were not subsequently publicly rescinded or updated. For the purpose of this FOIA request, we are concerned with the following 9 documents:

1. Diversity and Inclusion Strategic Plan (2012)
- Previously accessible at <https://www.archives.gov/about/plans-reports/strategic-plan/diversity-inclusion>
2. DEIA Strategic Plan (2022-2026)
- Previously accessible at <https://www.archives.gov/about/plans-reports/strategic-plan/diversity-inclusion>
3. Diversity Policy Statement
- Previously accessible at <https://www.archives.gov/eeo/policy/diversity-program>
4. Diversity and Inclusion Policy Statement
- Previously accessible at <https://www.archives.gov/eeo/policy/diversity-inclusion-policy-statement>
5. National Archives' Agency Equity Action Plan
- Previously accessible at <https://www.archives.gov/about/plans-reports/equity>
6. Archivist’s Task Force on Racism Report
- Previously accessible at <https://www.archives.gov/news/topics/recommendations-from-internal-task-force-on-racism>
6. NARA’s Statement on Potentially Harmful Content
- Previously accessible at <https://www.archives.gov/research/reparative-description/harmful-content>
7. Guiding Principles for Reparative Description   
- Previously accessible at <https://www.archives.gov/research/reparative-description-principles>
8. Anti-Harassment Policy
- Previously accessible at <https://www.archives.gov/eeo/policy/harassment-policy>
9. Affirmative Employment Program (AEP) Plan
- Previously accessible at <https://www.archives.gov/eeo/policy/affirmative-employment-program>

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of each of these nine policies, plans, reports, or official statements listed above.
2. For each, if it was subsequently modified or reissued, a copy of all historical and current versions.
3. For each, if it was subsequently rescinded or modified, any official memo (such as a NARA Notice) or communication (internal or external), wherein this update was announced.
4. For each, if it was subsequently rescinded or modified without being so memorialized, a copy of the email, meeting minutes, or other document where the Archivist, Acting Archivist, or other relevant NARA official formalized the decision to rescind or modify. In the absence of that copy of any communication from the General Counsel (or general counsel staff) relating that it was effectively invalidated or altered by an Executive Order or other administration policy would also suffice.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of any charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Darren Barton-McDougall

title: NSA Recordings of USS Liberty Attack Made by Marvin Nowicki
tags: israeli attack on the uss liberty

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NSA Recordings of USS Liberty Attack Made by Marvin Nowicki
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the IDF attacked our ship on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.

In a letter from retired NSA Analyst Marvin E. Nowicki, Ph.D., and published in The Wall Street Journal, Wednesday, May 16, 2001, page A-23, Mr. Nowicki refers to tapes he and a colleague recorded while aboard a US Navy EC121 while monitoring the events in the Eastern Mediterranean on June 8, 1967.

We are asking for a copy of the recordings referred to by Mr. Nowicki.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the body camera footage, surveillance footage, dashcam footage, interior squad car footage, relevant 911 calls, and photo evidence for the arrest of Tyrone Patterson Jr. on May 15th 2024, following a police pursuit that began in Chicago, Illinois, and concluded in Kenosha County, Wisconsin. Case number: 2024CF000758 Charges: 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, Resisting or Obstructing an Officer On May 15th 2024, 25-year-old Tyrone Patterson Jr. was apprehended after leading law enforcement on a multi-jurisdictional chase. The pursuit originated from an armed carjacking in Chicago, where Patterson allegedly stole a Toyota Camry. Chicago police tracked the vehicle via helicopter as it crossed into Wisconsin. Upon entering Kenosha County, deputies deployed stop sticks; Patterson continued to evade, eventually abandoning the vehicle and fleeing on foot before being arrested. He faces multiple felony charges, including fleeing and recklessly endangering safety, and is currently held on a bond exceeding $50,000. Please let me know of any costs associated with this request, thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Kehn

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Joseph Paolino Sr.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning and/or describing Joseph "Joe" Paolino Sr. (Born 1929; died September 12, 2012). He was one of the largest developers and real estate moguls in Rhode Island, and his death was covered in the press:

https://wrnipoliticsblog.wordpress.com/2012/09/12/r-i-p-joseph-r-paolino-sr-providence-real-estate-legend/

https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/providence/name/joseph-paolino-obituary?id=15527840

Paolino Sr. should not be confused with Joseph "Joe" Paolino Jr., who was a one-time mayor of Providence, and continues to run his father's company, Paolino Properties, today.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: America First Legal FOIA re: Visas

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: America First Legal FOIA re: Visas
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

(1) All records produced in response to the January 2, 2024, FOIA request from America First Legal (issued by Will Scolinos);

(2) Any correspondence sent to or from the requester with respect to that FOIA request.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 6 CFR § 5.5(e)(1)(ii) for the following reasons. Please note that the underlying request was processed on an expedited basis.

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and free expression, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely the Department's production of records in response to a FOIA request.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis for the reasons stated in the request for expedited processing in the underlying request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI FD-306 concerning JFK's assassination
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The transcript of oral briefing given to Miami-based Special Agent Thomas Errion on November 26, 1963 concerning the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. The transcript, typed by Dorothy Brooks, is referenced in the attached FBI document, which was released on March 18, 2025, pursuant to Executive Order 14176 issued by President Trump on January 23, 2025.

The form states that "the file where the original" is located is 134-379-Sub-A.

As the EO 14176 calls for "full and complete" disclosure of JFK records, I request a complete and unredacted copy of file identified as 134-379-Sub-A-113 and any other documents in the 134-379 Sub-A file that relate to JFK's assassination, including but not limited to information about Herminio Diaz, Lee Harvey Oswald, Cuban Student Directorate (DRE) and the Fair Play for Cuba Committee (FPCC).

Herminio Diaz Garcia died on May 29, 1966, according to the attached FBI report, so there is no grounds for withholding information about him.

Given strong public, congressional, and news media interest in the President Trump's order and the subsequent release of JFK, RFK, and MLK files, I ask for expedited treatment of this request.  As the editor of JFK Facts (jfkfacts.substack.com), an online newsletter with 20,000 subscribers, I will disseminate the results of this request immediately.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jefferson Morley

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I'm currently writing a book on the French ocean liner Normandie and having the information about the fire that destroyed the ship would be very important in NYC on Feb.9, 1942. The cause of the fire was deemed to be an accident despite many eyewitness accounts that it was sabotage.The initial report by the NYC Fire Marshal Thomas Brophy stated that the fire was caused by sabotage. But the day before the Marshal was going to release the report, he changed it to say that the fire was, in fact, an accident. Many people believe he was pressured by the FBI to accept the government version. I'm looking for the original Fire Marshal's report.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

george sucato

Request Title: Untitled

 Other Request 
Submission Method:
                                            
                                                Online/At Home 
Description of Records:
                                            
                                                To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I'm currently writing a book on the French ocean liner Normandie and having the information about the fire that destroyed the ship would be very important in NYC on Feb.9, 1942. The cause of the fire was deemed to be an accident despite many eyewitness accounts that it was sabotage.The initial report by the NYC Fire Marshal Thomas Brophy stated that the fire was caused by sabotage. But the day before the Marshal was going to release the report, he changed it to say that the fire was, in fact, an accident. Many people believe he was pressured by the FBI to accept the government version. I'm looking for the original Fire Marshal's report.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

george sucato

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Cancellation of Ryan Holiday speech
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications, on or after April 1, 2025, concerning the planned appearance by Ryan Holiday on April 14, 2025, as reported in this New York Times piece: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/04/19/opinion/naval-academy-speech-censorship.html.

2. Any communications, on or after April 1, 2025, concerning the cancellation, postponement, or rescheduling of Ryan Holiday's April 14, 2025 appearance.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 32 CFR § 286.8(e)(1)(i)(B) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and press freedom, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely the removal of books from a library due to their viewpoints or content and the cancellation of a speech on the basis that discussion of those books (or their removal) might violate an order of the President of the United States.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to breaking news story of public interest. That issue has attracted media coverage, including the Associated Press report identified above. The information has value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis.

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 32 CFR § 286.12(l), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to the cancellation of a speech based on its contents or viewpoint.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations. That information is not in the public domain and relates to a decision that has received attention from a prominent newspaper.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law, including its application to members of the press. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: E-Scooter Fatalities (Denver Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All reports, documents, and data related to fatalities involving electric scooters  from January 2022 to present
- Any investigative reports, medical examiner findings, or official determinations regarding cause of death in these incidents
- Statistical data or summaries regarding e-scooter fatalities maintained by the Reno Police Department or other city agencies
- Any communications between the City of Reno and Bird Scooters regarding fatalities

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Timothy

title: Lake Washington School District - Building access video and access logs - L.E. Scarr Resource Center - 16250 NE 74th St, Redmond, WA 98052 (JAN-APRIL 2025)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District - Building access video and access logs - L.E. Scarr Resource Center - 16250 NE 74th St, Redmond, WA 98052 (JAN-APRIL 2025)
communications.communication:
April 18, 2025

via email to PublicRecordsRequest@lwsd.org

Lake Washington School District - Building access video and access logs - L.E. Scarr Resource Center - 16250 NE 74th St, Redmond, WA 98052 (JAN-APRIL 2025)

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

To whom it may concern,

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production:

1. An electronic copy of all records and writings regarding people and personnel Building Access  for the Lake Washington School District Administrative Offices located in the L.E. Scarr Resource Center at 16250 NE 74th St, Redmond, WA 98052.

Responsive records include but are not limited to:

Key card access system(s)
Video surveillance system(s)
Electronic and Written access logs

Please provide complete records of all electronic key cards and the name and contact information of each person assigned each specific key card.

Please provide electronic copies of all recorded video surveillance from building cameras installed in the L.E. Scarr Resource Center for the time period January 1, 2025. to April 18, 2025.

Please provide electronic copies of all building access logs and any audits or reports of  building access for the time period January 1, 2025. to April 18, 2025.

Please provide any and all incident reports or investigations into any unauthorized building access at the L.E. Scarr Resource Center for the time period January 1, 2025. to April 18, 2025.

Please provide the name and contact information of all personnel authorized to access any Building Access Control Systems and devices in use at the L.E. Scarr Resource Center.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed contemporaneous exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed contemporaneous exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.
